org.chronos.chronodb.api

Enum DuplicateVersionEliminationMode

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<DuplicateVersionEliminationMode>
      • org.chronos.chronodb.api.DuplicateVersionEliminationMode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<DuplicateVersionEliminationMode>

    public enum DuplicateVersionEliminationMode
extends java.lang.Enum<DuplicateVersionEliminationMode>
    The mode in which duplicate versions are eliminated by ChronoDB.

    "Duplicated versions" occur when the same value for the same key is committed several times, without any other values in between. In other words, if a commit on a key occurs, and the committed value is exactly the same as the previous one, then a duplicate version is created. Duplicate versions are not "harmful" in and on themselves, but they also offer no additional information - they merely add more data to the database, reducing query performance in the process.

    This enumeration describes how ChronoDB should attempt to eliminate such duplicated versions.

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      DISABLED
      Completely disables duplicate version elimination.
      ON_COMMIT
      Duplicate version elimination will be performed when ChronoDBTransaction.commit() is called.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • DISABLED

        public static final DuplicateVersionEliminationMode DISABLED
        Completely disables duplicate version elimination.

        For a definition of the "Duplicate Version Elimination" process, please see DuplicateVersionEliminationMode.

        This means that a commit will be treated "as is", without even attempting to detect duplicated versions. This results in the best write performance, but may reduce query performance and needlessly increase the size of the database, as duplicated versions provide no additional information value.

        This setting is recommended under the following circumstances:

        • The write performance of a database or transaction has absolute priority over read performance.
        • The application logic which uses this ChronoDB instance performs duplicate version checks on its own.

      • ON_COMMIT

        public static final DuplicateVersionEliminationMode ON_COMMIT
        Duplicate version elimination will be performed when ChronoDBTransaction.commit() is called.

        For a definition of the "Duplicate Version Elimination" process, please see DuplicateVersionEliminationMode.

        This introduces a performance penalty on the commit() operation, as every key-value pair that has been added in this transaction via ChronoDBTransaction.put(String, Object) will be checked for version duplicates.

      • fromString

        public static DuplicateVersionEliminationMode fromString(java.lang.String stringValue)
        This method parses a string value into a DuplicateVersionEliminationMode.

        This method takes all aliases into account and is therefore more fault tolerant than the default valueOf(String) method.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The Duplicate Version Elimination mode described in the string. Never null.
        Throws:
